medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms started four days ago after eating fried rice. Initially, the patient experienced epigastric and right upper quadrant (RUQ) pain radiating to the back, accompanied by nausea and non-bilious emesis, lasting several hours before resolving. The pain returned the following day, waking her at 4 am, with a more generalized abdominal pain. Currently, the pain is persistent and localized to the RUQ and hypogastrium.
medical_history.past_medical_history: UTI many years ago; No prior operations; Allergies: None
medical_history.family_history: No family history of gallbladder disease
